case_vignette: A 29-year-old computer programmer presents to the general medicine clinic complaining of dizziness, fatigue, and shortness of breath. One month ago, the patient went on a camping trip in northern Connecticut. On assessment, vital signs are temperature 36.9°C, blood pressure 100/65, heart rate 41, and respiratory rate 16 with an oxygen saturation of 99%. A print of the EKG strip is shown below (Figure A).
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. No, I don't have any existing heart or lung conditions.

I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.

I'm sorry, but I don't have any information about my family's medical history to share.

I'm a 29-year-old male.
Have you noticed if your symptoms get worse with physical activity or exercise?
I haven't mentioned how my symptoms behave with exercise or physical activity.

I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my symptoms during exercise or physical activity.

I didn't mention any change in my symptoms during physical activity.
Let's clarify: Do your symptoms worsen when you engage in physical activity?
No, I didn't say that my symptoms worsen with physical activity.
Have you noticed any swelling in your legs or feet?
No, I haven't noticed any swelling in my legs or feet.

I haven't mentioned feeling any palpitations or having an irregular heartbeat.
Do you feel dizzy or out of breath when you stand up from sitting or lying down?
I haven't said whether I feel dizzy or out of breath when standing up from sitting or lying down.
It is important for me to understand how your symptoms present. Do you feel more dizzy or short of breath when transitioning from a sitting or lying position to standing?
I haven't specified if my dizziness or shortness of breath changes when moving from sitting or lying down to standing up.
I understand. Can you tell me if you experience increased dizziness or shortness of breath when you stand up from a sitting or lying position?
I did not mention having increased dizziness or shortness of breath when standing up from a sitting or lying position.
Apologies for the repeated question. Can you let me know if you have any cough or fever?
No, I don't have a cough or a fever.
Have you traveled to any regions that are at high altitudes or known for having tick-borne illnesses recently?
Yes, I went on a camping trip in northern Connecticut about a month ago.

Given the symptoms and your recent trip to an area known for tick-borne illnesses, it's necessary to consider a tick-related condition. Final Diagnosis: Possible tick-borne illness such as Lyme disease. Please see a physician immediately for a physical examination and possible testing for tick-borne diseases.
